hero.name: Andrew Osama
hero.title: Professional Web Developer
hero.description: I develop modern and interactive web applications using the latest technologies

about.title: Who I Am
about.description: A passionate frontend developer creating beautiful, functional digital experiences

bio.paragraph1: Hello, my name is Andrew Osama, a dedicated web designer specializing in front-end development with a strong foundation in computer science. I have a passion for creating visually appealing. My skill set combines creativity with technical expertise, allowing me to build experiences that are both engaging and efficient.
bio.paragraph2: Currently, I’m focused on enhancing my skills in Angular and React, which has enabled me to deliver faster, more interactive web experiences. I pride myself on my attention to detail and my ability to transform complex concepts into simple, impactful designs.I aim to bring ideas to life in a way that resonates with users, combining aesthetics with functionality for memorable digital experiences.

features.sectionDescription: Combining technical expertise with creative design to deliver exceptional results

cleanCode.title: Clean Code
cleanCode.description: I write clean, maintainable code following best practices and industry standards.

creativeDesign.title: Creative Design
creativeDesign.description: Eye-catching designs that capture attention while maintaining usability.

fastPerformance.title: Fast Performance
fastPerformance.description: Optimized websites that load quickly and provide smooth user experiences.

story.title: My Journey
story.paragraph1: Since I was a child, I have always been amazed by how things work. This curiosity has turned into a genuine passion for innovation and problem-solving.Today, I strive to build useful, user-focused applications that make a difference.
story.paragraph2: My journey in web development began with simple HTML pages. Over time, I discovered JavaScript and React, as well as server technologies like Node.js and MongoDB.
story.paragraph3: Every line of code I write represents a part of my story — and I'm still at the beginning.
